definition: to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: And as my sickness grows, my strength cedes .
sentences.chinese: 并且，当我的憔悴增长，我的力量割让。

sentences.english: France ceded Alsace-Lorrance to Germany in 1871.
sentences.chinese: 法国于1871年将阿尔萨斯和洛林割让给德国。

sentences.english: Any system that cedes those rights will lead to anarchy.
sentences.chinese: 任何割让那些权利的体制都将导致政治混乱。

sentences.english: Spain ceded the Philippines to the United States.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙将菲律宾群岛割让给美国。

sentences.english: The Spanish colonized the Philippines and ceded it to the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 是西班牙在菲律宾开拓殖民地并把它割让给美国。

sentences.english: The cession of the territory could not be avoided because they lost the war.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们输了这场战争，割让领土是无法避免的。

sentences.english: The Northern Mariana Islands were ceded to the US after WWII.
sentences.chinese: 北马里亚那群岛是二战后被割让给美国的。

sentences.english: Guam was ceded to the US in 1898 after the US-Spanish War.
sentences.chinese: 关岛是在西班牙战争之后，1898年割让给美国的。

sentences.english: Under the terms of the treaty, La Rochelle was ceded to the English.
sentences.chinese: 根据这个条约的条款，拉罗谢尔割让给了英国人。

sentences.english: The Qing government ceded China's Hong Kong to Britain.
sentences.chinese: 清政府把中国的香港割让给英国。

sentences.english: They conceded some of their land to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他们把一部分领土割让给敌人。

sentences.english: Canada was ceded to Britain by the 1763 Treaty of Paris.
sentences.chinese: 1763年签订的《巴黎条约》将加拿大割让给英国。

sentences.english: As a safeguard Sultan ceded Rembau and Linggi to the Dutch.
sentences.chinese: 苏丹把林茂和林吉割让给荷兰人，以作保证。

sentences.english: This island was ceded to Spain more than one hundred years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛屿在一百多年以前就割让给西班牙了。

definition: Treaty of Aigun, 1858 unequal treaty forced on Qing China by Tsarist Russia
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Treaty of Nerchinsk (1698) between Qing China and Russia
the Treaty of Beijing of 1860 between Qing China and Tsarist Russia
pinyin: Zhong1 E2 Bei3 jing1 Tiao2 yue1

definition: Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
